comments.body:
this needs to be validated with a call to metav1validation.ValidateConditions

since this is a new field, it can be validated even for v1beta1 (which means actually connecting v1beta1 status updates to validation specifically for this field)

I have added validation of the conditions to `ValidatePodDisruptionBudgetStatus`. This isn't actually used yet, but https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/99290 addresses this. I will make sure this validation gets run for all versions, while the existing fields will only be validated for v1.
go ahead and wire the validation here... we don't want to merge unvalidated APIs assuming validation will be added in a follow-up before release
Moved the code for wiring up status validation from https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/99290 into this PR.
please add "This is an alpha field, and is only honored if the API server enables the CSIInlineVolume feature gate." (here and in both external versions, and update swagger/doc files)
is this a free form string or some pre-defined types in the api ?
Driver name which is a string.
@liggitt is this comment useful for internal types as well?
I can't think of anything that gets generated off the internal types, so I don't think so
follow-up: we should maybe also mention that the kubelet has to whitelist them explicitly.
follow-up: mention that these must not be forbidden.
can be formulated in a neutral way, like: "It depends on the node to accept these unsafe sysctl as well".
I will mention it.
Done
I assume we don't expect to disrupt more than 2000 pods per cluster at a time?  Otherwise that will push us over the etcd value size (well, for etcd2).

It is not 2000 pods per cluster. It is 2000 pods per single disruption budget. And anyway, allowing >2000 disruptions is a bit weird, I guess that anyone running >2000 pods would either want to have limited number of disruptions (say 30) or don't care about disruptions at all because of the vast amount of pods. And if by any chance they care then they probably can deal with a bit slower deletion.
And ,btw, in alpha we had only 1 disruption at a time.

Maybe add a TODO to have the API server reject an eviction request if the associated PDB already has more than N entries in DisruptedPods? This situation should be self-correcting due to the timeout, so such a policy seems pretty reasonable.
Added a const and a check for not adding more than 2000 pods to DisruptedPods.
Mention that it is a subresource of pod, to be used with POST?
You wrote "done" in Reviewable but when I view the PR it doesn't seem to be updated. Did you push the new commit?
in a followup PR please change this to `/pods/<pod name>/evictions`
You can omit "Selector is a", but it's fine to fix this in a followup PR.
